{"step_by_step_thinking": "Postpartum hemorrhage is a serious condition that can occur after childbirth. The main goal of treatment is to stop the bleeding and prevent shock. Oxytocin and Syntometrine are commonly used to stimulate uterine contractions and reduce bleeding. Prostaglandins can also be used to stimulate uterine contractions. However, Oestrogen is not typically used in the treatment of postpartum hemorrhage as it does not have the same effect on uterine contractions.", "answer_choice": "C. Oestrogen"}
